shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 1r-178rb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 1r-140r) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 140v-155v) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 156r-163v) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 164ra-174ra) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 174ra -178rb).

donors.donor: The name Wälättä Mädḫǝn was inserted into supplication formulas in a secondary hand (e.g., fols. 9r, 19r, 28v, 47v, 63v, 122r, 125v, 133r, 143r, 156r, 164r).

txstates.txstate: The spine cover is partly torn off. Some fols. are stained with wax: e.g., fols. 1r-13r, 23r-34v). The upper margin of quire I and fol. 25 has been trimmed. Faded or blurred ink on fols. 25r, 32v, 33v, 172r-178r. A few holes and tears amended: e.g., fols. 9, 25, 92, 176, 177, 179.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 2 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: I(8/fols. 1r-8v) – II(8/fols. 9r-16v) – III(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 5; 5, before after 5/fols. 17r-24v) – IV(8/fols. 25r-32v) – V(8/fols. 33r-40v) – VI(7; s.l.: 4, stub after 3/fols. 41r-47v) – VII(8/fols. 48r-55v) – ፲VIII(10/fols. 56r-65v) – ተIX(10/fols. 66r-75v) – ደX(10/fols. 76r-85v) – XI(7; s.l.: 2, stub after 6/fols. 86r-92v) – ፩XII(10/fols. 93r-102v) – ፪XIII(9; s.l.: 8, stub after 1/fols. 103r-111v) – ፫XIV(10/fols. 112r-121v) – ፬XV(10/fols. 122r-131v) – ፭XVI(8/fols. 132r-139v) – ፮XVII(8/fols. 140r-147v) – ፯XVIII(10/fols. 148r-157v) – [፰]XIX(10/fols. 158r-165v) – ፱XX(10/fols. 166r-173v) – XXI(6/fols. 174r-179v).

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 10r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for fol. 165r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4 and I-5); titles and numbers of Pss. (Pss. 1, 5-64, 102-140, 142-151); titles of Canticles; doxology at the end of each Song; titles of Texts I-1, I-2, I-3 and I-5; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; second line of some Pss. (Pss. 37-42, 44-48,51, 55, 59-64); names of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 and the traditional interpretation of the name of the first letter, Aleph; letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስብሕዎ in Ps. 150; refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5 (written out fully or abbreviated); elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few lines on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-2, I-3 (two lines); a few lines on the incipit page of Text I-4 and incipits of its (sub)sections.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Text I-4 ሰአ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g., fols. 164va, 168rb) Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fol. 164ra-vb) እ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 165rb-166va) ኵ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 166vb-168ra) ወ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ(fols. 169ra-170rb, 173rb-vb) ለ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ ፡ (fols. 170vb-171rb) ተ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fol. 172ra-vb) ሰ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (fols. 164ra-173vb) Text I-5 ወ፡ (ሰ) for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (fol. 174va-178ra) The abbreviation stand for the whole refrain: ወ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 175va-178ra)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 is missing (except for Aleph). - Ps. 150 is numbered as ፻፵፲. - The following Pss. are numbered incorrectly: Pss. 70: ፷፲, 80: ፸፲, 100: ፺፲, 118: ፩ት (?). - Some Pss. with numbers from 100 onwards are numbered without the sign for 100, ፻ (e.g., Ps. 122 is numbered as ፳፪). - Ps. 107 is numbered as 108, mistake continues until Ps. 109; for the next Ps. 110, instead of the number, the scribe used a special, unusual sign: two crosses (?, s. fol. 107v). - Ps. 121 is numbered as 120, Ps. 130 as 129 and Ps. 131 numbered as 130. - The following Pss. are not numbered: Pss. 10, 44, 101 and 148. - Text I-3 contains interlineally inserted verses from Songs of Solomon (so called “Hebrew version”). For more information s. Ms. DD-004 ‘Other details’.

extras.extra: - From fol. 47v onwards, the Pss. are usually divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating black and red dots. - Short supplication written by the main hand for th scribe: fol. 178v. - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of a cross, indicating the place where the omissions written in the margin, in the main hand and in a secondary hand, belong: fols. 109r l.17., 115r l.5. - Omitted words and passages were inserted interlineally or in the margins, in different hands: e.g., fols. 8r, 10r, 20r, 34v, 44v, 62r, 70r, 93r, 109r, 115r, 138r, 140v. - Corrections written over erased words and passages, in different hands: e.g., fols. 6v, 16r, 17r, 22v, 30v, 62r, 65r, 76r, 102r, 124v, 129r. - Erasures, partly marked with thin lines: e.g., fols. 1v, 21v, 22r, 34r, 35rv, 39v, 51r, 55v, 76r, 88v, 92r, 98r, 100r, 112v, 119v, 127r, 128r. - Numeral ፲፭ is written in the inner margin before the first text line of Text I-3. - Erased note (several lines): fol. 178vb. - Short supplications for Wälättä Mädḫǝn, added in a crude secondary hand: fols. 9r, 19r, 28v, 47v, 63v, 122r, 125v, 133r, 143r, 156r, 164r. - Amharic ʾandǝmta-commentaries of Text I-3 are written interlineally on fol. 156r. - Writing exercises (also in Ethiopic syllabary), doodles and crude drawings: fols. 1r, 11r, 12r,13r, 16v, 18r, 19r, 27v, 37r, 38r, 39v, 42v, 54r, 56r, 58v, 62r, 64r, 111v, 122v, 123v, 126v, 175r, 179v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner of fols. 56r: ፲, 66r: ተ, 76r: ደ, 93r: ፩, 103r: ፪, 112r: ፫, 122r: ፬, 132r: ፭, 140r: ፮, 148r: ፯, 166r: ፱.
